main.name: Max Smith
main.bio: Hi, my name is Max Smith. I'm an aspiring front-end web engineer. Scroll down to view some of my education background and tech skills. I like web development for its creative component and stuctural discpline.  I also enjoy learning more about HTML, CSS, JS, and their corresponding frameworks.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to contact me using the following form.

education.degree: B.S. in Biopsychology, Cognition, and Neuroscience (one degree)
education.description: Rigorous Major that required a high level of personal organization, time management, analytical thinking and reasoning, and knowledge of the scientific method.

education.degree: Took a semester course in HTML/CSS.
education.description: This course focused on the technical understanding of and skill in HTML5 and CSS3. The course was fourteen weeks time.  I felt good about this course - our professor was disciplined and genuinely wanted us to understand all things HTML and CSS. The course culminated with a final website project.

Building upon the above-mentioned curriculum, the workshops presented by the Digital Workshop Center, based in Fort Collins, Colorado, fostered a greater and more broad understanding of the tools used by front-end software engineers.  The courses included Javascript I/II, Photoshop I/II, SEO, Google Analytics, and Essential Web Tools. The certificate culminated with a mentored Capstone Project.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
